PART 1: LINEAR EBUS FOR MEDIASTINAL STAGING

The patient was brought to the procedure suite and placed in supine position. After induction of general anesthesia and endotracheal intubation with an 8.0 mm ETT, the linear EBUS bronchoscope was advanced through the ETT.

Systematic mediastinal lymph node sampling was performed at the following stations:

Station 7: Id[REDACTED] hypoechoic lymph node measuring 19.5mm (short axis) x 24.9mm (long axis). 4 passes performed with 21G needle. ROSE: Granuloma.
Station 11L: Id[REDACTED] homogeneous lymph node measuring 18.1mm (short axis) x 17.4mm (long axis). 2 passes performed with 21G needle. ROSE: Malignant - squamous cell carcinoma.
Station 10R: Id[REDACTED] hypoechoic lymph node measuring 17.1mm (short axis) x 27.3mm (long axis). 4 passes performed with 21G needle. ROSE: Granuloma.
Station 4L: Id[REDACTED] homogeneous lymph node measuring 11.5mm (short axis) x 24.9mm (long axis). 3 passes performed with 21G needle. ROSE: Atypical cells.

PART 2: ROBOTIC BRONCHOSCOPY FOR PERIPHERAL LESION

Following completion of mediastinal staging, the Monarch robotic bronchoscopy system was deployed.

Target lesion: LUL anterior (B3)
Lesion characteristics:
- Size: 25.0 mm
- Distance from pleura: 7.6 mm
- CT appearance: Solid
- Bronchus sign: Positive
- PET SUV max: 9.6

Navigation was performed successfully with registration error < 3mm. The robotic catheter was advanced to the target location. Radial EBUS probe was deployed confirming eccentric view of the lesion.

Tool-in-lesion confirmation: Fluoroscopy

Sampling performed:
- Transbronchial forceps biopsies: 4 specimens
- TBNA: 3 passes
- Brushings: 2 specimens

ROSE result from peripheral lesion: Malignant - squamous cell carcinoma
